result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaclyn J Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim. 
  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.
  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Jaclyn J Adams, in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews PQ/WOR, chrgs + pnlts, Stip & Rec.  Deft enters NC plea to Ct. Court finds plea made f/v/k/i and finds Deft. guilty of Ct. 1.  Court D-RI Ct. 2.  Exhibit list. Atty Thompson heard.  Atty Wineke heard.  Statement by Deft. Court heard and ORDERS:

Ct. 1
sentence w/held
18 months 
20 hrs community servec
$100 + cc + domestic abuse surcharge  --to Clerk of Courts
no contact w/ victim
no violent contact with anyone
counseling as deemed appropriate by agent
AODA and follow thru
absolute sobriety
no premises where alcohol is main sale
bail shall be applied to costs

Prior: 207 S State Street, Waupun, WI 53963

Defendant, Jaclyn J Adams in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held. Has retained Eric Pitsch in Appleton WI. Court leaves on JT as scheduled. Address verified: 304 Main Ave, Unit 7, De Pere WI 54115.

(as previously posted)
  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.   Defendant shall submit a DNA sample at the Dodge County Jail.  Any defendant submitting a DNA sample may ask to have it expunged if applicable charges are dismissed  see Wis. Stat. Sec. 165.77(4).

9:09 - Defendant, Jaclyn J Adams in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court enters Not Guilty plea on defendant's behalf. Court sets $650 Cash bond (as previously posted) with conditions:   Defendant shall submit a DNA sample at the Dodge County Jail.  Any defendant submitting a DNA sample may ask to have it expunged if applicable charges are dismissed  see Wis. Stat. Sec. 165.77(4).   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Return date scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
